title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations for child care assistance for military dependents under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2008 for this purpose. The Secretary will provide grants to eligible persons for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. Eligible persons are parents of dependents who are members of a reserve component. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of a dependent who is a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces serving on active duty for a military operation. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of a dependent who is a member of the Armed Forces on active duty involved in a military operation, responsible for caring for dependents, and residing at least 50 miles from military child care facilities. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary. The term 'military operation' includes Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation of the United States Armed Forces. The grant can be used at the nearest child development center or family child care home funded by the Department of Defense for dependents of the member. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary, including details of the child care provider. The provisions of this subchapter, other than section 658P, do not apply to assistance provided under this section. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 regarding appropriations under different sections.
